metadata.title: CVE-2022-25375 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/usb/gadget/function/rndis.c in the Linuxkernel before 5.16.10. The RNDIS USB gadget lacks validation of the size ofthe RNDIS_MSG_SET command. Attackers can obtain sensitive information fromkernel memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25375` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
